trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when the server or the client cannot be reached for a previously specified period of time.
The RemotingTimeoutException is thrown when a remoting call does not complete in the specified timeout time.
RemotingTimeoutException uses the HRESULT COR_E_REMOTING, which has the value 0x8013150B.
RemotingTimeoutException uses the default <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> implementation, which supports reference equality.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of RemotingTimeoutException, see the RemotingTimeoutException constructors.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException"></xref> class with default properties.

The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> class: |Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|Localized error message for <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException>|
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException"></xref> class with a specified message.

The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> class: |Property Type|Condition| |-------------------|---------------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The `message` string|
The message that indicates the reason why the exception occurred.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception must include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.

The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> class: |Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|The inner exception reference| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string|
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

If the `InnerException` parameter is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, the current exception is raised in a <xref uid="langword_csharp_catch" name="catch" href=""></xref> block that handles the inner exception.
